item.title: Bookshelf
item.description:
Psychology & Behavioral Science

  • Thinking, Fast and Slow — Daniel Kahneman
  • Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking — Susan Cain
  • Antifragile — Nassim Taleb
  • The Coaching Habit — Michael Bungay Stanier
  • Lost Connections — Johann Hari
  • A Mind of Your Own — Dr. Kelly Brogan
  • The Winner Effect — Ian H. Robertson
  • The Expectation Effect — David Robson
  • Good Habits, Bad Habits — Wendy Wood

Science & Technology

  • Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind — Yuval Noah Harari
  • Other Minds — Peter Godfrey-Smith
  • The Beautiful Cure — Daniel M. Davis
  • Why We Sleep — Matthew Walker
  • Grain Brain — David Perlmutter
  • Breath — James Nestor
  • Python Tricks — Dan Bader
  • Measure, Integration & Real Analysis — Sheldon Axler
  • Algorithms to Live By — Brian Christian & Tom Griffiths
  • The Art of Statistics — David Spiegelhalter
  • Super Crunchers — Ian Ayres
  • How AI Will Change Your Life — Patrick D. Dixon
  • SQL Queries for Mere Mortals — John L. Viescas & Michael J. HernandezRecommendedReading

Personal Development & Self-Help

  • Atomic Habits — James ClearRecommended
  • The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People — Stephen R. Covey
  • Finish What You Start — Peter Hollins
  • Self Discipline — Gemma Ray
  • 365 Days With Self-Discipline — Martin Meadows
  • The 1% Rule — Tommy Baker
  • Greenlights — Matthew McConaughey
  • The War of Art — Steven Pressfield
  • The Seven Spiritual Laws of Success — Deepak Chopra
  • Happiness by Design — Paul Dolan
  • Ten Times Happier — Owen O’Kane
  • The Fitness Mindset — Brian Keane
  • Exactly What to Say — Phil M Jones
  • The Chimp Paradox — Steve Peters
  • How to Thrive in a World of Too Much — Tony Crabbe
  • The Source — Tara Swart
  • Into the Magic Shop — James R. Doty
  • The Little Book of Hygge — Meik Wiking
  • Ikigai — Héctor García, Francesc Miralles
  • A New Earth — Eckhart Tolle
  • The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying — Marie Kondo
  • Psycho-Cybernetics — Maxwell Maltz
  • The Daily Stoic — Ryan HolidayRecommended
  • The Rules of Work — Richard Templar
  • How to Win Friends and Influence People — Dale Carnegie
  • More Time to Think — Nancy Kline
  • First You Write a Sentence. — Joe Moran
  • Limitless — Jim Kwik

Business & Entrepreneurship

  • Good to Great — Jim Collins
  • Built to Last — Jim Collins
  • Zero to One — Peter Thiel
  • The Hard Thing About Hard Things — Ben Horowitz
  • The Millionaire Master Plan — Roger James Hamilton
  • $100M Offers — Alex Hormozi
  • Business Adventures — John Brooks
  • The Personal MBA — Josh Kaufman
  • Tools of Titans — Timothy Ferriss
  • The Checklist Manifesto — Atul GawandeRecommended
  • Think Like a Rocket Scientist — Ozan Varol
  • The Practice — Seth Godin
  • The Culture Code — Daniel Coyle
  • Bad Blood — John Carreyrou
  • One Up on Wall Street — Peter Lynch
  • Money — Rob Moore
  • Start Now. Get Perfect Later. — Rob Moore
  • The Chief Data Officer’s Playbook — Caroline Carruthers, Peter Jackson
  • Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) Getting Started Guide — Amazon Web Services
  • Amazon Relational Database Service: User Guide — Amazon Web Services
  • Trade Your Way to Financial Freedom — Van K. Tharp
  • Making Numbers Count — Chip Heath & Karla Starr
  • The Intelligent Investor — Benjamin Graham

History & Society

  • Factfulness — Hans Rosling, Ola Rosling & Anna Rosling Rönnlund
  • How the World Works — Noam Chomsky
  • The Lords of Easy Money — Christopher Leonard
  • The Spider Network — David Enrich
  • Flash Boys — Michael Lewis
  • A Brief History of Japan — Jonathan Clements

Memoirs & Biographies

  • Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of NIKE — Phil Knight
  • Finding My Virginity — Richard Branson
  • 38 Letters to his Son — John D. Rockefeller
  • The Salt Path — Raynor Winn
  • Poor - Katriona O’SullivanRecommended
  • Man’s Search for Meaning - Victor E FranklHighly Recommended

Fiction & Literature

  • The Secret Life of Bees — Sue Monk Kidd
  • A Little Life — Hanya Yanagihara
  • American Dirt — Jeanine Cummins
  • The Book Thief — Markus Zusak
  • He Said/She Said — Erin Kelly
  • Fairy Tale — Stephen King
  • The Importance of Being Earnest Illustrated — Oscar Wilde
  • The Remains of the Day — Kazuo Ishiguro

Fantasy & Sci-Fi

  • The Hobbit — J.R.R. TolkienRecommended
  • The Fellowship of the Ring (The Lord of the Rings, Book 1) — J.R.R. TolkienRecommended
  • The Two Towers (The Lord of the Rings, Book 2) — J.R.R. TolkienRecommended
  • The Return of the King (The Lord of the Rings, Book 3) — J.R.R. TolkienRecommended
  • Artemis — Andy Weir
  • Divergent (Divergent Trilogy, Book 1) — Veronica Roth

Health & Wellness

  • The Gut Feeling — Naomi Devlin
  • The Doctor’s Kitchen — Dr. Rupy Aujla
  • Veggie BBQ — Joe Wicks
  • Ottolenghi SIMPLE — Yotam Ottolenghi

Writing & Communication

  • Write Great Essays! — Peter Levin

Sports & Recreation

  • How to Win the Premier League — Ian Graham

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description:
Reading

The Art of Statistics: Learning from Data - David Spiegelhalter [Link]

The Checklist Manifesto: How To Get Things Right - Atul Gawande [Link]

Completed

Poor - Katriona O’Sullivan - [Link]

Bought this on a whim when I saw it as a Kindle special deal, and I’m glad I did. It covers what it means to be poor, and how some of the most vulnerable in society can fall through the cracks, how the system can let them down. The failure of the state, society, and people to help the most vulnerable. Whilst this is a difficult read in parts, it’s also a book about hope, and whilst there were failures in the system, it’s that same system that allowed Katriona to escape that life through the help of people, education, and her determination for something better.
